snippet: The decline adds a new factor to the Federal Reserve’s imminent decision whether or not to raise interest rates this month.
abstract: Labor Department reports its Consumer Price Index fell 0.1 percent in August, after rising 0.1 percent in July.
lead_paragraph: The decline adds a new factor to the Federal Reserve’s imminent decision whether or not to raise interest rates this month.

headline.main: Consumer Prices Fall, Aided by Gas Prices and Strong Dollar
headline.print_headline: Consumer Prices Fall, Aided by Decrease in Gas Prices
